cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 530 miles ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the north-western Gulf toward the middle–lower Texas coast (Matagorda/Calhoun County area) through Saturday, then inland across south-central Texas.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O'Connor – Matagorda Bay, Texas

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Mansfield to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire middle and lower Texas coast and adjacent north-western Gulf waters
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible late Friday through Saturday with low–moderate (22%) chance of sustained 34 kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–3 ft possible in Matagorda and Lavaca Bays causing elevated water levels at the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 in widespread with isolated 6 in; potential for localized flash flooding at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning Thursday night; possible brief power interruptions and minor coastal flooding affecting port operations.
